intro: Altriarabis amplexicaulis, commonly known as the clasping sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and fleshy, succulent stems. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in sandy and rocky soils, demonstrating a high degree of drought tolerance. Altriarabis amplexicaulis is well adapted to harsh desert environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
